assignmentText:
In this exercise you will investigate the reaction of washing soda (sodium carbonate, Na2CO3) with hydrochloric acid (aqueous HCl) to form "table salt" (sodium chloride, NaCl) and water and carbon dioxide. You will use quantitative measurements to find out how many moles of NaCl are formed from 1 mole of Na2CO3. You will use this information to write a balanced equation for this synthesis reaction.

(Note: In this exercise the PreciseTransfer mode has been disabled so you must use the "Realistic Transfer" technique. In addition, only the mass units (grams) are shown)

Chem116 students should follow the recommended procedure and complete the report worksheet: Chem116ChemMoles.doc.
